one.block.eosiojava.implementations

Class ABIProviderImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • one.block.eosiojava.implementations.ABIProviderImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IABIProvider

    public class ABIProviderImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements IABIProvider
    Default ABI Provider implementation, providing in memory caching of previously fetched ABI's as well as fetching of ABI's using the provided RPC provider.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ABIProviderImpl(@NotNull IRPCProvider rpcProvider, @NotNull ISerializationProvider serializationProvider)
      Initialize a new ABI Provider, passing the necessary RPC provider to fetch ABI's if they are not found in the cache.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Return an ABI given the chain id and account name desired.
      @NotNull java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getAbis(@NotNull java.lang.String chainId, @NotNull java.util.List<EOSIOName> accounts)
      Return a map of ABIs given the chain id and account names desired.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ABIProviderImpl

        public ABIProviderImpl(@NotNull
                       @NotNull IRPCProvider rpcProvider,
                       @NotNull
                       @NotNull ISerializationProvider serializationProvider)
        Initialize a new ABI Provider, passing the necessary RPC provider to fetch ABI's if they are not found in the cache.
        Parameters:
        rpcProvider - RPC provider implementation to use to fetch ABIs if they are not in the cache.
        serializationProvider - Serialization provider implementation to use to deserialize the ABIs for return and storage in the cache.

    • Method Detail

      • getAbis

        @NotNull
public @NotNull java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getAbis(@NotNull
                                                                                  @NotNull java.lang.String chainId,
                                                                                  @NotNull
                                                                                  @NotNull java.util.List<EOSIOName> accounts)
                                                                           throws GetAbiError
        Return a map of ABIs given the chain id and account names desired. The in-memory cache will be checked first and any missing ABIs will be fetched via the RPC provider and placed in the cache. This call is synchronous. Developers should wrap it in an asynchronous mechanism to avoid blocking if necessary.
        Specified by:
        getAbis in interface IABIProvider
        Parameters:
        chainId - the chain id
        accounts - the accounts - duplicate names will be removed
        Returns:
        Map of ABIs keyed by the account
        Throws:
        GetAbiError - If there is an error retrieving or deserializing any of the ABIs

      • getAbi

        @NotNull
public @NotNull java.lang.String getAbi(@NotNull
                                                 @NotNull java.lang.String chainId,
                                                 @NotNull
                                                 @NotNull EOSIOName account)
                                          throws GetAbiError
        Return an ABI given the chain id and account name desired. The in-memory cache will be checked first and if missing the ABI will be fetched via the RPC provider and placed in the cache. This call is synchronous. Developers should wrap it in an asynchronous mechanism to avoid blocking if necessary.
        Specified by:
        getAbi in interface IABIProvider
        Parameters:
        chainId - the chain id
        account - the account
        Returns:
        abiJsonString - the deserialized JSON string for the requested ABI
        Throws:
        GetAbiError - If there is an error retrieving or deserializing the ABI.
